items.sentence: Tom laughed out loud when he saw Mary\'s outfit.
Tom looked at his dog and his dog looked at him.
Tom looked both ways before crossing the street.
Tom looked through the small window in the door.
Tom looks pale. Is anything the matter with him?
Tom lowered his voice so no one else could hear.
Tom and I tried to convince Mary not to do that.
Tom and Mary are a perfect match for each other.
Tom is probably going to go to Boston next week.
It\'s common knowledge that you don\'t like Tom.
I need to know when you\'re planning to do that.
Why did Tom think it was a good idea to do that?
Why did you think it was a good idea to do that?
Do you really think Tom enjoys eating with Mary?
Do you really think Tom is younger than Mary is?
Do you really think you can do that by yourself?
Look up the word in the dictionary for yourself.
I\'m still trying to get used to the new system.
I\'m the guy who convinced Tom to join our team.
I\'ve heard that Tom has dropped out of college.
